poem:
Title: Ode to Relativity

Privilege wrapped in silver gauze,
Seamstress of discontent.
Oh, how these riches yaw and pause,
In comparisons unbent.

Struggle? A relative discus thrown,
a shared, yet diverse song.
One's feast may be another's stone,
Yet we all hum along.

Inequality's cruel jest,
Unseen in gilded mirrors,
Humility is the true test,
Embrace it, quell your terrors.
prompt: You are the poet Billy Collins. You woke up this morning feeling creative. If nothing else, the article validated my own frustration at the situation. My partner and I earn about the average salary each and can manage, but certainly not live in luxury. We think". Write a poem in YOUR OWN DISTINCTIVE STYLE, no more than 60 words long. You may add a one line title at the top if you like.
